body:
Thanks for creating an issue. I think this would be implemented by adding support to [`acorn-jsx`](https://github.com/RReverser/acorn-jsx), which is used by [`espree`](https://github.com/eslint/espree), ESLint's default parser.

Separately, we would also need to upgrade `espree` to the latest version of `acorn-jsx` in order for the change to take effect. This isn't a big problem, but it is nontrivial (see https://github.com/eslint/espree/issues/345).

Actually, it seems like JSX fragments have already been added to `acorn-jsx` in https://github.com/RReverser/acorn-jsx/commit/1a71881bad60e96be607f7cb25ee28dad9a8fbb5, so we would just need to upgrade `acorn-jsx` in `espree` to support them.
As far as I know, upgrading `acorn-jsx` has a breaking change about `JSXText` node. This might need to wait for the next major version of ESLint.
In https://github.com/eslint/espree/issues/345, there was some discussion about adding an option to Espree to avoid the breaking change in `acorn-jsx`.

issue.title: Update: Support JSXFragment node

labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
**What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to item)**

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ x ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofixing to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

**What changes did you make? (Give an overview)**

This is related to https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/9662.
Currently, when a parser, such as `babel-eslint` is used, it'll now return `JSXFragment`. This PR updates some standard rules to add some support for fragments so that `JSXFragment`s can generally be used in the place of `JSXElement`.

**Current behavior example**

```
<>foo</>;
```

warns that foo should be wrapped in quotes, using the options:

```
"parser": "babel-eslint",
"rules": { "quotes": [ "error", "single" ] }
```

**Behavior with my changes**

```
<>foo</>;
```

doesn't give any warnings!

**Rationale**

I'm just throwing this out here because I'm not really sure if this is a change makes sense to make in this repo at this point in time. This is only applicable when an external parser is specified. If this makes sense, then I can refine the PR. ðŸ™‚

body: The fragment syntax is working for me with Babel 7 beta 3, however using fragments is triggering eslint's quotes rule ("Strings must use doublequote").

issue.title: React 16.2 fragment syntax triggers

repository.name: babel-eslint
repository.description: :tokyo_tower: A wrapper for Babel's parser used for ESLint (renamed to @babel/eslint-parser)

issue.body:
Reacr 16.2 introduced fragments. This feature is accompanied by a syntactic sugar. The following component is now valid in React:

```jsx
import React from 'react';


export default () => (
  <>
    <div />
  </>
)
```

When using the default ESLint parser, this causes a syntax error.
When using the `babel-eslint` parser, this triggers the quotes rule.

issue.title: Add babel/quotes rule for JSXFragment workaround

repository.name: eslint-plugin-babel
repository.description: An ESlint rule plugin companion to babel-eslint

issue.body:
Depends on https://github.com/babel/eslint-plugin-babel/pull/138.

Until acorn is bumped in ESLint (ref: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/9662), this allows the JSX fragment shorthand syntax to not trip the `quotes` rule.

Related babel-eslint thread:
https://github.com/babel/babel-eslint/issues/554

issue.title: Support JSX fragments

repository.name: ink
repository.description: ðŸŒˆ React for interactive command-line apps

issue.body:
Fixes #46

This adds support for using the new React Fragments `<></>`. 
However: `plugin-transform-react-jsx` only supports them from babel v7 and on, which has no moved to `@babel/plugin-transform-react-jsx`, which requires `@babel/core`, which would mean `@babel/register` should be used instead of `babel-register`. Again, in order to use babel 7, ava had to be bumped to use the new `1.0.0-beta` versions. 

Coulnd't get xo to play nice with the fragments. I kept getting this error:
```
test/components.js:672:6
  âœ–  672:6  Parsing error: Unexpected token >  
```
Maybe @sindresorhus can help me figure out how to get xo to recognize them.

This would also mean that every package that uses ink, should also upgrade to the new babel versions. 

A less invasive way of introducing fragments would be to ommit the shorthand `<></>` syntax and jsut add a `<Fragment></Fragment>` component which would basically be a `span`. That wouldn't require any new package versions.
